title: Thunderbird Message Transfer
content:
I need to transfer messages from my old computer to new computer. From what I have read, the process of transferring my profile seems straightforward for whitch I'll be able to handle. However, from what I have read transferring my profile will not transfer my local folders.

I have read dozens of online articles releated to the transfer, but only a few articles even mention how to handle the local folders, and those that do mention it are confusing and seem to gloss over it as if no one uses local folders. Can someone point to a good write-up on how to handle moving my local folders.

Thank you for any help.
creator: sdadolf

creator: petewalton

title: Prevent Lightning Reminder window from stealing focus
content:
Specific 'Calendar' topic, but could also be considered to be about updating (improving) the Thunderbird controls/options/addons.

Is this a Feature Request, per say? If so, is it in the right place here? If not, where to put this?

Platform: Windows 10. Issue: Thunderbird (Lightning/Calendar) keeps aggressively stealing focus, i.e. putting the Reminder window on top of whatever else I am doing. This is incredibly annoying and unproductive. The only option is to completely disable Reminders, which defeats the purpose of course. See also, for example, https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/185c727/how_can_i_prevent_the_reminders_window_from/. Requirement: I would like to still hear the Reminder sound, and it would be great if the application also 'gets highlighted' (in orange) on the Taskbar (like many applications that have something new going on, but do not immediately push themselves to the foreground) to get a visual Notification, as well.

In any case, this overly dominant behaviour of the application should NOT persist.
creator: engage1

title: Thunderbird download from server
content: Using the latest Beta version I have had two issues over the last week. These occurred after I powered up in the AM and launched Thunderbird. In the first instance all the messages that were downloaded (about 20) would only display in HTML code. In the second instance about 20 downloads were replaced by an email I had received 3 years ago, displayed without a sender or a recipient in the message. Once downloaded, I can't figure our how to download these messages again (correctly I hope). I had to read the messages on my phone. Help.
creator: lanejm47

title: Thunderbird shows wrong Sender name for Email received at my gmail address
content:
On an Email message retrieved by Thunderbird from my Gmail account, the sender-name shown in my Inbox is different from the sender-name shown when I look at the message directly in my Gmail account. When I reply to the message via Thunderbird, it uses the correct sender-name.

I assume that there must be at least two fields in the Email message that would identifying the sender-name of the message. I tried to find out more from the RFC5322 specs here: 

   https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5322

My guess is that Thunderbird is getting whatever it displays as the sender-name in my inbox from a different field from what it uses as the "To" name when I reply to a message. For most messages, these two fields are probably the same, so there's no noticeable difference. But attached screenshots illustrate the difference:

[1] Thunderbird Inbox wrongly shows Sender as "Dan Sullivan" (deceased husband of sender, who may have been the account holder when the Earthlink Email address was setup many years ago)

[2] Gmail Inbox show Sender as "Margaret Sullivan" (writer of the message)

[3] Thunderbird reply correctly shows the recipient as "Margaret Sullivan"

This isn't a huge problem. (When I pointed out the oddity in my reply to my friend, I told her that "(Personally, I enjoyed the reminder of Dan's charming smile.)" But it probably should be added to the list of things to tidy up whenever anybody's modifying the relevant component of the Thunderbird program.

Of course, my friend can probably prevent it from happening by changing some field in whatever software she uses for writing/receiving Emails, but that might be more trouble than it's worth for a non-geek. Happy New Year! Thanks to Thunderbird for providing the Email client software I've been happily using for many years, and hope to continue doing so for many years to come.
creator: MandyWh

title: Thunderbird 115.5.0 (64-bit) Supernova, Downloaded Emails Eat All My SSD Storage Capacity
content:
Dear Mozilla,

There is an annoying habit with my Thunderbird 115.5.0 (64-bit) Supuernova email client, which is on my Ubuntu 23.10 O.S., and that is that whenever I install a new copy of Thunderbird, and I properly add my personal Gmail account, that it downloads 18-years worth of old emails; which are still stored in my Gmail account server online.

This HP Spectre x360 15" inch laptop, only has 250 GB of SSD storage, and by the time all those emails are downloaded, Ubuntu is giving me error messages about the Filesys being out of storage, etc.

Is there any to limit the years worth of old Gmails to download? Can I place a limit of only 5 years back/worth of message, so that people such as myself, that are sensitive to overall system storage limitation; can have their system properly functioning and system error free?

Please help, as I'm tired of constantly wiping my SSD and reinstalling my operating system, and trying to get my development environment just as I previously had it.

This is an annoying issue that I can't tolerate any further.

Thank you.
creator: MrPina

title: Duplicate emails since updating password
content:
Hi,

I've used Thunderbird for years and all was good until I decided to change my email password today. I'm using Thunderbird 115.6.0.

I started by updating my password but that led to a problem where it would ask for my password every time I sent an email, even after ticking the box for it to remember the password. I decided to remove the email account and add it again.

The email account is now working but I am receiving emails twice; every new message is duplicated.

If I delete either of the duplicate emails it deletes the other! It doesn't send them to trash, it deletes them both completely so they're gone.

I can't see what's causing this. My SMTP port number is set as 587 which is wrong according to my website settings but if I change it to what my hosts say it should be the account stops work.

The only solution I have seen is to download a duplicate removal plugin called "Remove Duplicate Messages" but doing this generated 570 blank emails from the year 1970 (I often get blank emails from 1970).

I don't understand why it isn't working now when it was before. Any help would be greatly appreciated because I can't find anything about this online.
creator: pgdodd61
